content: The "Keep Student Loans Affordable Act of 2013" extends the interest rate deadline to July 1, 2014. It also includes modifications to required distribution rules for pension plans. The "Keep Student Loans Affordable Act of 2013" extends the interest rate deadline to July 1, 2014 and includes modifications to required distribution rules for pension plans, specifically regarding the distribution of an employee's interest after their death. The distribution of an employee's interest after their death is subject to exceptions for eligible designated beneficiaries, with distributions made over the beneficiary's life expectancy. If an eligible designated beneficiary meets certain criteria, distributions must begin within a year of the employee's death. The portion allocated to the beneficiary will be treated as distributed on the date distributions begin. The distributions to the surviving spouse of the employee must begin no earlier than the date the employee would have turned 70 1/2. If the surviving spouse dies before receiving distributions, the rules will be applied as if the spouse were the employee. The rules upon the death of an eligible designated beneficiary state that if they die before the employee's interest is fully distributed, the remaining portion must be distributed within 5 years.
